text:
Hey, just a quick questions:
If I use a MACRO in my hubl code, can I define default value for arguments? For example:
{% macro lessons(id_lesson,id_table="33333") %}
In this case if I don't give a value for the second argument, will use 33333?
I just tried and seems to work.. but I would like a confirmation from the community :smile:

Hi Claudio, yes you can, just not quite how you’re doing it. One way you can is simply test if the value exists, if not, set it. Logic is allowed inside of macros.

If you’re not trying to do the same default everywhere the macro is used, you can also use `|default("default value")`
with the related posts tag, is there a way to get the `count` outside of the macro?
